data.title: Classic Books
data.meta_description: Classic Books of the Read.gov website
data.text:
"A Apple Pie"

Introduces the letters A to Z while following the fortunes of an apple pie.

Read This Book Now

More About this Book

“A Princess of Mars,” first in the John Carter series

First in series from the creator of Tarzan, this book features swordplay, daring feats, romance and six-limbed green aliens as Confederate Captain John Carter finds himself mysteriously transported to Barsoom, which we know as Mars.

Read This Book Now

More About this Book

"Aesop's Fables"

The fables of Æsop, based on the texts of L'Estrange and Croxall.

Read This Book Now

More About this Book

"Adventures of Huckleberry Finn"

This great American novel follows the adventures of a teenager and his life on the Mississippi River.

Read This Book Now

A girl named Alice falls into a rabbit hole, where she encounters a world of strange creatures.

The manuscript was originally presented to the Daughters of the American Revolution, Mary Clap Wooster Chapter, in New Haven, Conn., June 14, 1895, by Mrs. Henry Champion.
